ETYMOLOGY: From Spanish 'el lagarto' (the lizard), from Latin 'lacertus' (lizard). The 'al-' is from the Spanish definite article 'el' (the).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A large carnivorous reptile of the family Alligatoridae, native to freshwater habitats in the southeastern United States and China, characterized by a broad head and a rounded snout.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 鳄鱼科的一种大型肉食性爬行动物，原产于美国东南部和中国淡水地区，特点是头部宽阔，吻部呈圆形。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We watched an alligator swim slowly across the pond.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们看着一只短吻鳄缓慢地游过池塘。
